intro: Ozothamnus antennaria, commonly known as the slender everlasting pea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, exhibiting a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Ozothamnus antennaria is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant.
